verses.kjv: The burden of the valley of vision. What aileth thee now, that thou art wholly gone up to the housetops?
verses.ct: A message about the Valley of Vision. What is wrong with you that everyone has climbed up to the rooftops?

verses.kjv: Thou that art full of stirs, a tumultuous city, a joyous city: thy slain men are not slain with the sword, nor dead in battle.
verses.ct: You city full of commotion, you noisy, celebrating town — your dead were not killed by the sword, and they did not fall in battle.

verses.kjv: All thy rulers are fled together, they are bound by the archers: all that are found in thee are bound together, which have fled from far.
verses.ct: All your leaders ran away together and were captured without a fight. Everyone found in the city was taken prisoner, even though they had fled from far away.

verses.kjv: Therefore said I, Look away from me; I will weep bitterly, labour not to comfort me, because of the spoiling of the daughter of my people.
verses.ct: So I said, 'Turn away from me! Let me cry uncontrollably. Don't try to comfort me over the destruction of my people.'

verses.kjv: For it is a day of trouble, and of treading down, and of perplexity by the Lord GOD of hosts in the valley of vision, breaking down the walls, and of crying to the mountains.
verses.ct: For the Lord GOD of Armies has brought a day of panic, trampling, and confusion in the Valley of Vision — walls are being battered down, and cries echo off the mountains.

verses.kjv: And Elam bare the quiver with chariots of men and horsemen, and Kir uncovered the shield.
verses.ct: Elam carried quivers of arrows alongside chariots and cavalry, and Kir brought out its shields.

verses.kjv: And it shall come to pass, that thy choicest valleys shall be full of chariots, and the horsemen shall set themselves in array at the gate.
verses.ct: Your finest valleys will be packed with chariots, and horsemen will take up positions at the gates.

verses.kjv: And he discovered the covering of Judah, and thou didst look in that day to the armour of the house of the forest.
verses.ct: Judah's defenses were stripped away, and on that day you turned to the weapons stored in the Palace of the Forest.

verses.kjv: Ye have seen also the breaches of the city of David, that they are many: and ye gathered together the waters of the lower pool.
verses.ct: You noticed how many gaps there were in the walls of the City of David, and you collected water in the lower reservoir.

verses.kjv: And ye have numbered the houses of Jerusalem, and the houses have ye broken down to fortify the wall.
verses.ct: You counted the houses of Jerusalem and tore some of them down to reinforce the wall.

verses.kjv: Ye made also a ditch between the two walls for the water of the old pool: but ye have not looked unto the maker thereof, neither had respect unto him that fashioned it long ago.
verses.ct: You built a reservoir between the 2 walls to hold water from the old pool — but you never turned to the one who planned all this, and you never considered the one who designed it long ago.

verses.kjv: And in that day did the Lord GOD of hosts call to weeping, and to mourning, and to baldness, and to girding with sackcloth:
verses.ct: On that day, the Lord GOD of Armies called for weeping, mourning, shaved heads, and wearing rough cloth.

verses.kjv: And behold joy and gladness, slaying oxen, and killing sheep, eating flesh, and drinking wine: let us eat and drink; for to morrow we shall die.
verses.ct: But instead — celebration and partying! Butchering cattle and slaughtering sheep, eating meat and drinking wine! 'Let's eat and drink, because tomorrow we die!'

verses.kjv: And it was revealed in mine ears by the LORD of hosts, Surely this iniquity shall not be purged from you till ye die, saith the Lord GOD of hosts.
verses.ct: The LORD of Armies revealed this directly to me: 'This sin will never be forgiven — not until you die,' says the Lord GOD of Armies.

verses.kjv: Thus saith the Lord GOD of hosts, Go, get thee unto this treasurer, even unto Shebna, which is over the house, and say,
verses.ct: This is what the Lord GOD of Armies says: 'Go to this official, to Shebna, who manages the royal palace, and tell him:

verses.kjv: What hast thou here? and whom hast thou here, that thou hast hewed thee out a sepulchre here, as he that heweth him out a sepulchre on high, and that graveth an habitation for himself in a rock?
verses.ct: "What right do you have here? Who do you have buried here, that you carved out a tomb for yourself in this place — cutting your tomb up high and chiseling out a resting place for yourself in the rock?"

verses.kjv: Behold, the LORD will carry thee away with a mighty captivity, and will surely cover thee.
verses.ct: Pay attention — the LORD is about to grab you and hurl you away with force. He will wrap you up tightly.

verses.kjv: He will surely violently turn and toss thee like a ball into a large country: there shalt thou die, and there the chariots of thy glory shall be the shame of thy lord’s house.
verses.ct: He will spin you around and throw you like a ball into a vast, open land. There you will die, and there your impressive chariots will become a disgrace to your master's household.

verses.kjv: And I will drive thee from thy station, and from thy state shall he pull thee down.
verses.ct: I will remove you from your position, and he will tear you down from your place of authority.'

verses.kjv: And it shall come to pass in that day, that I will call my servant Eliakim the son of Hilkiah:
verses.ct: On that day, I will summon my servant Eliakim son of Hilkiah.

verses.kjv: And I will clothe him with thy robe, and strengthen him with thy girdle, and I will commit thy government into his hand: and he shall be a father to the inhabitants of Jerusalem, and to the house of Judah.
verses.ct: I will dress him in your robe, tie your sash around him, and hand your authority over to him. He will be like a father to the people of Jerusalem and to the nation of Judah.

verses.kjv: And the key of the house of David will I lay upon his shoulder; so he shall open, and none shall shut; and he shall shut, and none shall open.
verses.ct: I will place the key to the house of David on his shoulder. When he opens a door, no one will shut it; when he shuts it, no one will open it.

verses.kjv: And I will fasten him as a nail in a sure place; and he shall be for a glorious throne to his father’s house.
verses.ct: I will drive him in like a peg hammered into a solid wall, and he will bring honor and glory to his father's family.

verses.kjv: And they shall hang upon him all the glory of his father’s house, the offspring and the issue, all vessels of small quantity, from the vessels of cups, even to all the vessels of flagons.
verses.ct: All the weight of his father's household will hang on him — children and descendants, every small container, from cups to jars.

verses.kjv: In that day, saith the LORD of hosts, shall the nail that is fastened in the sure place be removed, and be cut down, and fall; and the burden that was upon it shall be cut off: for the LORD hath spoken it.
verses.ct: On that day,' declares the LORD of Armies, 'the peg driven into the solid wall will give way. It will be cut loose and fall, and everything hanging on it will be destroyed.' The LORD has spoken.
